alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 18 at 4:51PM EST until November 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, heavy lake effect snow occurring. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Greatest snow accumulations expected along the immediate lakeshore from downtown Erie to North East. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 inches or more possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie county. * WHEN...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, until midnight EST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times. Expect poor visibility in periods of steady to heavy snow and slick, snow- covered roads.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
